name: natural stone plate production, cut | natural stone plate, cut | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/4730/documentation

The drilling for the mining process is assumed to be done with compressed air, which is produced with electricity. The sawing is assumed to be accomplished with diamond wires. The diamond losses are not taken into account even though they might be significant as no data on diamond production is available. The dust emissions are estimated based on the losses (volume of granite with a density of 2?750 kg/m3) by cutting a plate with the geometry 0.5 * 0.5 * 0.03 m and a weight of 20 kg. It is assumed that 95% of the dust is bound in the cooling water.;[This dataset was already contained in the ecoinvent database version 2. It was not individually updated during the transfer to ecoinvent version 3. Life Cycle Impact Assessment results may still have changed, as they are affected by changes in the supply chain, i.e. in other datasets. This dataset was generated following the ecoinvent quality guidelines for version 2. It may have been subject to central changes described in the ecoinvent version 3 change report (http://www.ecoinvent.org/database/ecoinvent-version-3/reports-of-changes/), and the results of the central updates were reviewed extensively. The changes added e.g. consistent water flows and other information throughout the database. The documentation of this dataset can be found in the ecoinvent reports of version 2, which are still available via the ecoinvent website. The change report linked above covers all central changes that were made during the conversion process.]

Includes the raw material granite, the mining, sawing and cooling, the transports within the mine and to the regional storage in Switzerland and the infrastructure (machines). No administration, wastewater, wear and spare parts are included. Dust is accounted for.
category: C:Manufacturing/23:Manufacture of other non-metallic mineral products/239:Manufacture of non-metallic mineral products n.e.c./2396:Cutting, shaping and finishing of stone

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: For some exchanges RER- and GLO-modules are used as proxy
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Typical technology for average Swiss production. Mining of boulders by direct separation from rock, whole to whole drilling, kerving wire saw, oxygen lance and water jet. Cutting by wire saw.

exchanges.description:
Calculated value.

0.5 m*0.5 m*0.03 m are the dimensions of the natural stone plate
0.56 m2 is the calculated surface of one natural stone plate
0.0075 m3 is the calculated volume of the natural stone plate
2750 kg/m3 is the density of the natural stone plate
20.625 kg is the weight of one natural stone plate

Values related to dust emission calculations;

0.01m is the slitting width of the cut
0.5 - half of each cutting losses is allocated to one plate
0.15 - 0.55 - 0.3 is the ratio between different sizes of particles (>10microm - 2.5microm><10microm - <2.5microm)
0.95 - 0.05 is the ratio between emissions which are bound and released to the water and those which are emitted to air
Calculated value based on literature values and expert opinion. See comments in the parametres' comment field.
